Moreover, you will be introduced to two fundamental concepts: assignments and functions. ## üë®‚Äçüè´ Lecture Slides Either click on the slide area below or click [here](/2024Spring/material/slides/T2-Basics-Functions.pdf) to download the slides. ```{=html}

``` ::: ## üìö Mandatory Reading - Tutorial [First steps in R](/2024Spring/tutorials/first-steps/index.qmd) - [Chapter 2](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/workflow-basics) in @r4ds. ### üèÜ Further readings - [R Studio Cheat Sheet](https://rstudio.github.io/cheatsheets/html/rstudio-ide.html) - [Chapter 4](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/workflow-style) in @r4ds. - [Chapter 8](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/workflow-help) in @r4ds. ## ‚úçÔ∏è Coursework - Do the `Basics` exercises of the package `DataScienceExercises` ::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"} ## Quick code for starting the exercises ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} learnr::run_tutorial( name = "Basics", package = "DataScienceExercises", shiny_args=list("launch.browser"=TRUE)) ``` ::: ::: - Do the `Functions` exercises of the package `DataScienceExercises` ::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"} ## Quick code for starting the exercises ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} learnr::run_tutorial( name = "Functions", package = "DataScienceExercises", shiny_args=list("launch.browser"=TRUE)) ``` ::: ::: - If you have questions or problems, please post them in the Moodle forum
